feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 27 at 4:19AM AKDT until June 27 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued June 27 at 3:14AM AKDT until June 27 at 8:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area and Southern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 8 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 26 at 1:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 10:29AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Calhoun and southeastern Etowah Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1029 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gadsden Mall, or near Gadsden, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 27 at 3:23AM HST until June 27 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR SOUTH FACING SHORES OF ALL ISLANDS... .A long period south swell is peaking this morning and will continue to produce advisory level surf today. The swell is expected to decline late this afternoon through tonight, though another pulse of south swell should keep south shore surf elevated through Tuesday.

James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE...

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 27 at 5:50AM PDT until June 27 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Temperatures in the mid 80s to lower 90s expected this afternoon, hottest in valley locations. The exception will be elevations above 5000 feet, where afternoon temperatures should generally be in the 60s and 70s. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades and South Washington Cascade
entry.cap:areaDesc: South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 27 at 5:50AM PDT until June 27 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Temperatures of 90 to 95 degrees are expected this afternoon. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia, Greater Portland Metro Area, Upper Hood River Valley, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, I-5 Corridor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; Western Columbia River Gorge

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 27 at 3:55AM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High temperatures of 98 to 103. * WHERE...In Washington, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington. In Oregon, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 27 at 3:55AM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High temperatures of 98 to 106 expected. * WHERE...In Washington, Lower Columbia Basin of Washington, Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington and Yakima Valley. In Oregon, Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 27 at 3:08AM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the upper 80s to low to mid 90s today. Overnight low temperatures this morning will likely only cool into the 60s for many locations. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 9:48PM PDT until June 29 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...minor flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING...
